title: Drawing, "Inscription"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. A drapery is intended to serve as a tablet. It is framed by two crossed branches which have on either side two crossed weapons. On top is a wreath with, inside, an escutcheon with a prelate's hat. Written in the upper right corner "117". Usual background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Inscription".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1840.
